hyperedges.text: Sliding work sharing between humans and AI/robots

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence.

entities.name: Robots
entities.description: Mechanical devices controlled by AI.

entities.name: Humans
entities.description: Individuals in an industrial setting.

entities.name: Work
entities.description: Tasks performed by humans and AI/robots.

entities.name: Sliding work sharing
entities.description: Approach where the balance between human and machine activities varies during the operation, depending on the situational context, machine-based confidence levels and human interactions.
Referenced work related to sliding work sharing.
Referenced work related to sliding decision making.

hyperedges.text: The term 'sliding work sharing' (SWS) was introduced by AI4Work project proposal [80].

entities.name: sliding work sharing
entities.description: A concept related to automation and task distribution.

hyperedges.text: The related concept of 'sliding autonomy' could be identified.

entities.name: sliding autonomy
entities.description: A concept related to adjustable levels of robot autonomy.

hyperedges.text: Sliding autonomy was researched extensively in the domains of robotics and (multi-)agent systems [82].

entities.name: robotics
entities.description: The study of robots.

entities.name: (multi-)agent systems
entities.description: The study of multiple autonomous entities interacting with each other.

hyperedges.text: The aim is to vary the level of autonomy during operation, depending on the respective situation.
Highly autonomous robots can help reducing the mental load of human operators [83] and they can also be used in hostile environments, where humans may not be able to work [81,84].

entities.name: highly autonomous robots
entities.description: Robots capable of operating independently for extended periods.

hyperedges.text: It is hardly possible (or very time-consuming) to program robots in a way that they can react to all potential challenges that may happen in dynamic real-world environments [81,83,87].
Humans should at least monitor the robots' work and should be able to intervene in case of robots 'being stuck' or in case of potential safety hazards.
Another motivation for sliding autonomy may be to dynamically adjust the robots' autonomy level depending on the skill level of the human who is controlling the robot [86].
Different scenarios regarding sliding autonomy are discussed in the existing literature.
A variety of potential levels of autonomy may be differentiated, e.g. considering the ten levels of automation suggested in [85].
When considering sliding autonomy of robots, the three main levels that are most relevant can be summarized as follows:
• Fully autonomous: the robot is working autonomously, without any human involvement.

entities.name: fully autonomous
entities.description: A level of autonomy where the robot operates independently.

hyperedges.text: Robot autonomy levels

entities.name: Intermediate Autonomy
entities.description: The robot works autonomously but can receive temporary human support or control.

entities.name: Unexpected Issue
entities.description: A situation that prevents the robot from continuing its work or decreases its performance, causing human involvement.

entities.name: Robot-initiated Human Involvement
entities.description: The robot detects an issue and informs the human for support.

entities.name: Human-initiated Human Involvement
entities.description: The human proactively intervenes due to observed inefficiency, incorrect behavior, safety hazards, or risk of losing the robot.

entities.name: System-initiative Sliding Autonomy
entities.description: Human involvement is only reactive to the robot asking for help.

entities.name: Mixed-initiative Sliding Autonomy
entities.description: Both the robot and human can initiate human involvement.

entities.name: Pre-planned Human Involvement
entities.description: Human intervention is planned for specific tasks that are hard to automate.

hyperedges.text: Reasons for Robot-initiated Human Involvement

entities.name: Robot Blocked/Trapped
entities.description: The robot is unable to move due to an obstacle.

entities.name: Low Self-confidence
entities.description: The robot doubts its ability to succeed in a given task.

entities.name: Timeout
entities.description: The robot did not complete the task within a specific time or number of tries.

entities.name: Task Assignment to Human
entities.description: The robot delegates a task to a human in peer-to-peer teams.

hyperedges.text: Reasons for Human-initiated Human Involvement

entities.name: Inefficient Work
entities.description: The human observes that the robot's work could be made more efficient.

entities.name: Incorrect Behavior
entities.description: The robot is behaving in a way that is not as intended or expected.

entities.name: Safety Hazard
entities.description: The robot's actions may potentially cause collisions, endanger other robots, or humans.

entities.name: Loss of Robot
entities.description: There is a risk of losing the robot, especially in hostile environments.

hyperedges.text: Sliding Autonomy compared to Fully Autonomous Robots and Manual Operation

entities.name: Sliding Autonomy
entities.description: A control strategy that allows robots to operate autonomously but with human intervention.

entities.name: Experiment
entities.description: Research process involving either physical or simulated scenarios.

entities.name: Performance
entities.description: Evaluation of the efficiency and effectiveness of robots based on factors like required time, error rate, workload for human operator.

entities.name: Fully Autonomous Robot
entities.description: A robot that operates independently without any human intervention.

entities.name: Manual Operation
entities.description: Control of a robot by a human operator.

entities.name: Human Operator
entities.description: The individual responsible for controlling and supporting the robot.

entities.name: Multi-robot Team
entities.description: A group of robots working together under a common goal.

entities.name: SWS
entities.description: An organization with the goal of finding the ideal balance between human and machine activities.

hyperedges.text: The state of the art regarding sliding autonomy of robots in the upcoming development of SWS mechanisms requires considering a basic difference between robots and AI: while humans can easily see that a physical robot requires help or could become a safety hazard, this may not be as easy or even impossible for a human working together with an AI.

entities.name: sliding autonomy of robots
entities.description: The ability of a robot to gradually take over tasks from a human operator.

entities.name: SWS mechanisms
entities.description: Software systems that manage the interaction between humans and autonomous systems.

entities.name: human
entities.description: A person interacting with a robot or AI.

entities.name: physical robot
entities.description: A tangible machine designed to perform tasks automatically.

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial intelligence, a system capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence.

hyperedges.text: Sometimes the AI may provide answers of low accuracy or trustworthiness in case the basis to learn from was not very solid (e.g. learning data sets that were either too small or did not cover all situations that occur in the real work environment).

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial intelligence.

entities.name: low accuracy
entities.description: An AI's inability to provide accurate results.

entities.name: trustworthiness
entities.description: The reliability and credibility of an AI's output.

entities.name: learning data sets
entities.description: Data used to train an AI.

entities.name: real work environment
entities.description: The actual situation where the AI is expected to perform tasks.

hyperedges.text: Therefore, the above-mentioned topics of safe AI monitoring (section 3.5.2) as well as explainable/transparent AI will be important to consider in relation to SWS.

entities.name: safe AI monitoring
entities.description: Techniques for ensuring the safety of AI systems.

entities.name: explainable/transparent AI
entities.description: AI systems that can be easily understood and their decision-making processes can be traced.

entities.name: SWS
entities.description: Software systems that manage the interaction between humans and autonomous systems.

hyperedges.text: The scenario involves a set of input orders, each specifying products to be produced, a destination, and urgency levels.

entities.name: raw materials
entities.description: Materials like tapes, labels, and boxes available in different sizes.

hyperedges.text: The AI4WORK solution is designed to intelligently schedule the production line under these conditions.

entities.name: AI4WORK
entities.description: An intelligent system that schedules the production line.

hyperedges.text: The line manager will utilize the output plan to assign activities accordingly.

entities.name: line manager
entities.description: Individual responsible for assigning activities based on the output plan.

hyperedges.text: The system will dynamically adjust the plan in real-time based on feedback.

entities.name: system
entities.description: Intelligent system that adjusts the production line plan in real-time.

hyperedges.text: Technologies used include Data collection and handling for AI/Robotics Services, Human-Centred Digital Twins of processes and employees, Context Awareness, Human-aware Task Planning for human-machine interaction, and Sliding Work Sharing.

entities.name: Data collection and handling
entities.description: Technology used for data management in AI/Robotics Services.

entities.name: Human-Centred Digital Twins
entities.description: Technology that creates digital representations of processes and employees.

entities.name: Context Awareness
entities.description: Technology that understands the current situation or environment.

entities.name: Human-aware Task Planning
entities.description: Technology that considers human capabilities in task planning.

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing
entities.description: Technology used for distributing work between humans and machines.

hyperedges.text: Requirements include providing a tool for the automatic generation of line plans considering available human and machine resources, considering optimization metrics, adapting the output plans to new requests of workload balancing between the human and the machine, considering inputted constraints on available resources (e.g., materials), using a digital twin to simulate production line scenarios, including both the human operators and involved machines.

entities.name: tool for automatic generation of line plans
entities.description: A tool that generates production line plans automatically.

entities.name: optimization metrics
entities.description: Factors considered in the optimization of resources.

entities.name: workload balancing between human and machine
entities.description: The distribution of work between humans and machines.

entities.name: inputted constraints on available resources (e.g., materials)
entities.description: Restrictions based on the availability of resources.

entities.name: digital twin
entities.description: A digital representation used to simulate production line scenarios.

hyperedges.text: Sliding Work Sharing (SWS) Management

entities.name: SWS Management
entities.description: Manages the balance between human and AI/robot activities during operation.

entities.name: AI/Robot
entities.description: Autonomous system working alongside humans.

entities.name: Human
entities.description: Individual collaborating with AI/robot.

entities.name: Uncertainty Estimation
entities.description: Measure of confidence in AI/robot's performance.

entities.name: Context Information
entities.description: Details about the current work situation.

entities.name: Experience/Skills
entities.description: Knowledge and abilities of human or AI/robot.

entities.name: Plan's Validation
entities.description: Results from validating the plan.

entities.name: Pilot Use Cases
entities.description: Variety of human-AI/robot work sharing situations in different scenarios.

hyperedges.text: Initiation of workflow

entities.name: Human
entities.description: A person who initiates the workflow

entities.name: Robot
entities.description: An automated machine that can perform tasks

entities.name: AI4Work technology
entities.description: Technology used for workflow management

entities.name: External system
entities.description: An external entity that can initiate a workflow

hyperedges.text: Request for action

entities.name: Work situation
entities.description: A situation where an action/decision is required

hyperedges.text: Contextual information extraction

entities.name: Context Awareness component
entities.description: A component that extracts contextual information about the current work situation

hyperedges.text: Decision/action suggestion

entities.name: AI/robot
entities.description: An AI or robot that suggests a decision/action based on context information

hyperedges.text: Trustworthiness estimation

entities.name: Runtime Monitoring for trustworthy AI
entities.description: A component that estimates the confidence/uncertainty of an AI's decision

hyperedges.text: Human involvement

entities.name: Human-centred Digital Twin
entities.description: A component that provides information about the skills/experience of the human

hyperedges.text: Decision/recommendation

entities.name: SWS Management component
entities.description: A component that decides or recommends the extent of AI/robot autonomy and human involvement

hyperedges.text: Degrees of automation

entities.name: Automation level
entities.description: The degree to which the AI/robot can work autonomously

hyperedges.text: Re-planning

entities.name: SWS Management component
entities.description: A component that decides if a re-calculation of the work plan is required

hyperedges.text: Sliding Module

entities.name: Sliding Module
entities.description: Responsible for dynamic sliding decision at runtime with pilot/use-case-specific rules.

entities.name: Decision Engine
entities.description: Applies the rules of the Sliding Module to current input data.

entities.name: Rule Storage
entities.description: Contains pilot/use-case-specific rules for the Sliding Module.

hyperedges.text: Workflow Orchestrator

entities.name: Workflow Orchestrator
entities.description: Controls the flow of inputs and outputs to other systems/components.

entities.name: Workflow Definition Storage
entities.description: Keeps the use-case-specific workflow definition.

entities.name: Workflow Executor
entities.description: Reads the workflow definition and orchestrates the work.

hyperedges.text: Integration with Existing Systems/Custom GUI

entities.name: Existing System
entities.description: Can adapt its behaviour based on the decision/recommendation of the SWS Management component.

entities.name: Custom GUI
entities.description: Shows the decision to an end-user and may also present the identified context.

hyperedges.text: Context Awareness Component

entities.name: Context Awareness Component
entities.description: Provides current context information about the work situation.

hyperedges.text: Runtime Monitoring for Trustworthy AI

entities.name: Runtime Monitoring for Trustworthy AI
entities.description: Provides uncertainty estimation.

hyperedges.text: Human-centric Digital Twin

entities.name: Human-centric Digital Twin
entities.description: Provides data about the experience/skills of the human.

hyperedges.text: Feedback from Human

entities.name: Human
entities.description: Provides feedback through the Common Frontend or existing system.

hyperedges.text: AI4Work Common Frontend

entities.name: AI4Work Common Frontend
entities.description: Provides a common interface for the SWS Management component.

hyperedges.text: Components interacting and sharing data for decision-making

entities.name: Human-aware Task Planner
entities.description: Plans tasks based on human awareness

entities.name: Long-term Adaptation components
entities.description: Adapts plans over long periods

entities.name: Pilot-specific AI modules
entities.description: Provides decisions/actions for specific pilots

entities.name: Context Awareness component
entities.description: Sends trigger messages about events requiring sliding decisions

entities.name: External system
entities.description: Provides data or sends trigger messages

entities.name: End user
entities.description: Sends trigger messages about events requiring sliding decisions

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing Management component
entities.description: Decides on human involvement, support, and workflow orchestration

entities.name: Legacy system/GUI
entities.description: Acts based on decisions/recommendations of SWS Management component

hyperedges.text: Evaluation Approach for AI4Work

entities.name: AI4Work
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence concept for work

entities.name: Evaluation
entities.description: Assessment of AI4Work effectiveness

entities.name: Individual Level Evaluation
entities.description: Evaluating AI4Work impact on individuals

entities.name: Organisational Level Evaluation
entities.description: Evaluating AI4Work impact on organizations

entities.name: Mixed-Method Approach
entities.description: Combining quantitative and qualitative data collection methods

entities.name: Surveys, Questionnaires, Wearables
entities.description: Tools used for data collection

entities.name: Interviews, Focus Groups, Co-creation Activities
entities.description: Additional tools for qualitative data collection

entities.name: Statistical Methods, Content Analysis
entities.description: Tools used for data analysis

entities.name: Focal Enterprises
entities.description: Enterprises collaborating in the evaluation process

hyperedges.text: Monitoring of tool deployments and evaluation of their impact on work

entities.name: tool deployments
entities.description: process of implementing a software or hardware system in an organization

entities.name: impact on work
entities.description: change in productivity, efficiency, or quality of work due to the implementation of new tools

entities.name: real-time feedback
entities.description: immediate response or information provided to users about their actions or performance

entities.name: interactive mechanisms
entities.description: methods that allow users and systems to communicate and collaborate effectively

entities.name: active learning aspects of AI4Work components
entities.description: capabilities of AI4Work that enable it to learn from user interactions and adapt accordingly

entities.name: historical monitoring data
entities.description: information collected over time about the performance or usage of a system

entities.name: unsatisfactory user experience
entities.description: dissatisfaction or frustration experienced by users due to poor design, usability, or functionality of a system

entities.name: pilot phase
entities.description: initial testing and implementation period of a new system or product in a limited environment

entities.name: KPIs
entities.description: key performance indicators used to measure the success or effectiveness of a project, process, or system

hyperedges.text: Establishment of control and treatment groups for pilot cases with sufficiently large application subject pools

entities.name: control group
entities.description: a set of subjects or entities used as a comparison to the treatment group in an experiment

entities.name: treatment group
entities.description: a set of subjects or entities that receive a specific treatment or intervention in an experiment

entities.name: sufficiently large application subject pools
entities.description: a population size that allows for the formation of control and treatment groups with statistical significance

hyperedges.text: Use of synthetic control groups and event studies methodologies for cases with subject pools that do not permit forming control groups

entities.name: synthetic control group
entities.description: an artificial control group created using statistical techniques to mimic the characteristics of a real control group

entities.name: event studies
entities.description: a research approach that examines the impact of an event or intervention on a specific outcome

hyperedges.text: Technical KPIs for AI4Work components

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence-based systems in the context of work.

entities.name: Technical KPIs
entities.description: Indicators used to evaluate technical performance.

entities.name: Efficiency
entities.description: Ability of AI4Work components to perform tasks effectively.

entities.name: Accuracy
entities.description: Correctness of the results produced by AI4Work components.

entities.name: Explainability
entities.description: Ability to understand and interpret the decisions made by AI4Work components.

entities.name: AI solutions
entities.description: The AI systems within AI4Work components.

entities.name: Human workers
entities.description: People collaborating with the AI solutions.

hyperedges.text: Accuracy KPIs measure the degree to which an AI model generates a correct output for the problem given the available data.

entities.name: Accuracy
entities.description: Degree of correctness in AI model's output.

entities.name: AI model
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence system generating output.

entities.name: Problem
entities.description: Issue or question the AI model is solving.

entities.name: Data
entities.description: Information used by the AI model.

hyperedges.text: Latency measures a system's responsiveness, typically in terms of the time it takes to process one unit of data.

entities.name: Latency
entities.description: System's response time.

entities.name: System
entities.description: AI system being measured.

entities.name: Data
entities.description: Unit of data being processed.

hyperedges.text: Reliability metrics evaluate whether the AI system behaves according to its design intentions.

entities.name: Reliability
entities.description: AI system's adherence to design.

entities.name: AI System
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence system being evaluated.

hyperedges.text: Robustness measures the ability of an AI system to perform in varying circumstances, e.g., in variations in the input data and context.

entities.name: Robustness
entities.description: AI system's adaptability to different conditions.

entities.name: AI System
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence system being assessed.

hyperedges.text: Safety

entities.name: System's capability to minimize unintentional harm
entities.description: Refers to a system's capability to minimise unintentional harm stemming either from unexpected system actions or misuse of human operators.

entities.name: SWS safety measures
entities.description: Should primarily focus on assessing the safety of the CPS's human actors.

entities.name: Safety incidents
entities.description: Relevant KPIs are recordings of safety incidents.

entities.name: Questionnaires querying operators about perceived safety
entities.description: Relevant KPIs are questionnaires querying operators about their perceived safety.

entities.name: Logistics pilot
entities.description: Safety and compliance measurements are relevant, e.g., for the logistics pilot.

hyperedges.text: Scalability

entities.name: System's ability to maintain operational capacities
entities.description: Concerns a system's ability to maintain its operational capacities in response to changes (typically up-scaling) of processing and input data demands.

entities.name: Performance metrics
entities.description: Are measured in terms of variability of performance metrics (e.g., processing time) as a function of varying complexity.
References for further information.

hyperedges.text: Security

entities.name: System's ability to prevent unintended execution, unauthorised access, and data leakage
entities.description: Refer to a system's ability to prevent unintended execution, unauthorised access, and data leakage.

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Should identify and withstand external threats and adversarial attacks and be capable of maintaining information integrity.

entities.name: Risk-based security metrics and penetration testing performance
entities.description: Are used to measure a system's security attributes.
References for further information.

hyperedges.text: Operational KPIs

entities.name: Performance of operational units
entities.description: Used to measure the performance of operational units.

entities.name: Standardisation work on operational KPIs
entities.description: Extensive standardisation work on operational KPIs exists for example regarding manufacturing and automation.
References for further information.

entities.name: AI4Work's pilots
entities.description: Operational KPIs are generalised to render them applicable to a broader range of processes and can be used when evaluating the contribution of the AI4Work tools in their operational environments.

entities.name: Modularity
entities.description: Is a necessary condition for the evaluation of AI4Work's contributions because, first, not all of the project's components are uniformly applicable to all pilots and, second, those that are applicable to multiple pilots may affect the pilots' workflows and processes, and even different tasks within a pilot's process, in heterogeneous ways.

hyperedges.text: The impact of AI4Work components on operational units is assessed through operational KPIs.

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence for Work components

entities.name: operational units
entities.description: Operational systems within an application environment

entities.name: operational KPIs
entities.description: Key Performance Indicators used to evaluate operational performance

hyperedges.text: Cost/benefit ratios are relevant for logistics, manufacturing, construction, and agriculture pilots.

entities.name: Cost/benefit ratios
entities.description: Measures associating costs with benefits of a process

entities.name: logistics
entities.description: Movement of goods from one location to another

entities.name: manufacturing
entities.description: Production of goods or products

entities.name: construction
entities.description: Building, renovation, or repair of structures

entities.name: agriculture
entities.description: Farming and related activities

hyperedges.text: Cycle time KPIs measure the performance of the entire CPS and separate AI4Work components.

entities.name: cycle time KPIs
entities.description: Key Performance Indicators measuring elapsed time between task initiation and completion

entities.name: CPS
entities.description: Cyber-Physical System

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence for Work components

hyperedges.text: Delivery reliability KPIs are relevant for the manufacturing pilot.

entities.name: delivery reliability KPIs
entities.description: Key Performance Indicators measuring supplier's capacity to serve customers on time

entities.name: manufacturing
entities.description: Production of goods or products

entities.name: AI4Work components

entities.name: End-consumers
entities.description: Final users of the system's output

entities.name: Satisfaction
entities.description: Level of contentment with the system's output

hyperedges.text: Costs

entities.name: Process
entities.description: Operation of AI4Work system

entities.name: Energy consumption
entities.description: Amount of energy used in the process

entities.name: Maintenance costs
entities.description: Costs associated with maintaining the system

entities.name: (Re-)configuration costs
entities.description: Costs related to adjusting the system

hyperedges.text: Flexibility

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Components of AI4Work system

entities.name: Re-configuration or set-up time
entities.description: Time required for a component to adjust to alternative context requirements

hyperedges.text: Productivity

entities.name: Process
entities.description: Operation of AI4Work system

entities.name: Labour
entities.description: Workforce involved in the process

entities.name: (Physical) capital
entities.description: Physical resources used in the process

entities.name: Output units per unit (or batch) of input

hyperedges.text: Quality metrics measure the degree to which a process meets the demanded specifications or requirements. The quality of AI4Work tools can be measured by the amount of unsatisfactory output while the system operates either autonomously or in conjunction with human actors. Quality KPIs are relevant for manufacturing, construction, education, and healthcare pilots.

entities.name: Quality metrics
entities.description: Degree to which a process meets demanded specifications or requirements.

entities.name: AI4Work tools
entities.description: Tools incorporating AI for work applications.

entities.name: unsatisfactory output
entities.description: Result that does not meet specified requirements.

entities.name: manufacturing
entities.description: Production of goods on a large scale.

entities.name: construction
entities.description: Building or constructing infrastructure.

entities.name: education
entities.description: Process of facilitating and guiding learning.

entities.name: healthcare
entities.description: Provision of medical services.

hyperedges.text: Return on investment is an investment's profitability measure. The return on investment of the system can be measured as the difference between the initial cost of introducing the AI4Work components in a process and the resulting expected discounted future marginal benefits. For instance, return on investment is relevant for the logistics, manufacturing, construction, and agriculture pilots. However, its measurement is less relevant within the project lifecycle and is more relevant in potential investment decisions afterwards.

entities.name: Return on investment
entities.description: Profitability measure of an investment.

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Individual parts or aspects of AI4Work system.

entities.name: process
entities.description: Series of actions or operations.

entities.name: logistics
entities.description: Management of the flow of goods between the point of origin and the point of consumption.

entities.name: manufacturing
entities.description: Production of goods on a large scale.

entities.name: construction
entities.description: Building or constructing infrastructure.

entities.name: agriculture
entities.description: Cultivation of land and its resources by farming, fishing, or forestry activities.

hyperedges.text: Routing flexibility measures assess the capability of a process to complete an operation in multiple ways. In a traditional manufacturing environment, routing flexibility is measured as the number of ways a part type can be produced. In the AI4Work context, routing flexibility can be measured as the number of proposed ways (allocations) a task can be shared between human and AI actors.

entities.name: Routing flexibility
entities.description: Capability to complete an operation in multiple ways.

entities.name: part type
entities.description: Specific category of parts or components.

entities.name: traditional manufacturing environment
entities.description: Manufacturing process without AI integration.

entities.name: AI4Work context
entities.description: Manufacturing process with AI integration.

entities.name: task
entities.description: A piece of work to be accomplished.

hyperedges.text: Human-centric KPIs primarily measure qualitative and quantitative aspects of work design from a human involvement perspective at the individual and organisational levels. They are relevant for measuring both blue- and white-collar work aspects [52].

entities.name: Human-centric KPIs
entities.description: Metrics focusing on human involvement in work design.

entities.name: qualitative and quantitative aspects
entities.description: Both subjective and objective features.

entities.name: work design
entities.description: Planning, organizing, and managing work tasks.

entities.name: individual level
entities.description: Single person's perspective or involvement.

entities.name: organisational level
entities.description: Collective or systemic perspective within an organization.
Referenced source for information.

hyperedges.text: Agency. Agency metrics traditionally measure the discretion of human agents when making decisions to carry out work (human agency). Agency can be measured via qualitative user assessments, e.g., questionnaires, interviews, and focus groups [53], [54], [55], [56], [57], [58]. For CPS with AI agents exhibiting autonomous behaviour, pre-application agency metrics and post-application operators' surveys can be used to evaluate the ability of AI actors to take over tasks requiring decision-making autonomy (technical agency).

entities.name: Agency
entities.description: Discretion of human or AI agents in making decisions.

entities.name: human agency
entities.description: Discretion of human agents in work decision-making.

entities.name: qualitative user assessments
entities.description: Subjective evaluation methods like questionnaires, interviews, and focus groups.
Referenced source for information.
Referenced source for information.
Referenced source for information.
Referenced source for information.
Referenced source for information.
Referenced source for information.

entities.name: CPS with AI agents exhibiting autonomous behaviour
entities.description: Computerized systems with AI agents acting independently.

entities.name: pre-application agency metrics
entities.description: Evaluation of agency before AI implementation.

entities.name: post-application operators' surveys
entities.description: Assessments by operators after AI implementation.

entities.name: technical agency
entities.description: AI actor's ability to make decisions autonomously.

hyperedges.text: The SWS Management component uses fuzzy logic for decision making based on two variables: ai confidence level and human experience level. The suggested work sharing approach is calculated using fuzzy rules.

entities.name: SWS Management component
entities.description: System for managing Software Services.

entities.name: fuzzy logic
entities.description: A method used to deal with reasoning that is approximate rather than exact.

entities.name: ai confidence level
entities.description: Variable representing the AI's certainty.

entities.name: human experience level
entities.description: Variable representing the human's expertise.

entities.name: suggested work sharing approach
entities.description: The decision about the degree of AI autonomy vs. the degree of human involvement.

hyperedges.text: The membership functions define the degree of membership in the fuzzy sets low/medium/high for each input value.

entities.name: membership functions
entities.description: Functions defining the degree of membership in fuzzy sets.

hyperedges.text: Fuzzy rules are applied to translate the input values and make decisions.

entities.name: fuzzy rules
entities.description: Rules used to make decisions based on fuzzified input.

hyperedges.text: The values for the two input variables and the output variable have ranges that can be adapted for a concrete pilot application scenario.

entities.name: input variables
entities.description: Variables with adjustable value ranges for specific pilots.

entities.name: output variable
entities.description: Variable with an adjustable range for specific pilots.

hyperedges.text: The application of fuzzy logic in SWS Management component

entities.name: fuzzy logic
entities.description: A method used for dealing with reasoning that is approximate rather than exact

entities.name: SWS Management component
entities.description: System responsible for work sharing management in AI4Work

hyperedges.text: Flexibility of fuzzy logic approach in different use cases

entities.name: fuzzy logic
entities.description: A method used for dealing with reasoning that is approximate rather than exact

entities.name: use case
entities.description: Specific scenario or application of the fuzzy logic approach

hyperedges.text: Customization of fuzzy rules and variables

entities.name: fuzzy rules
entities.description: Set of rules used in fuzzy logic

entities.name: variables
entities.description: Values used in the fuzzy logic calculations

entities.description: Use of technology to operate machinery without human intervention

entities.name: recruitment
entities.description: The act of hiring employees

entities.name: automated industries
entities.description: Industries heavily reliant on automation technology

entities.name: challenges
entities.description: Difficulties faced in the recruitment process

hyperedges.text: The shift to advanced automated equipment introduces challenges for operators and maintainers, production managers, and requires a higher level of problem-solving and planning expertise.

entities.name: operators
entities.description: Individuals responsible for operating machinery in traditional manufacturing.

entities.name: maintainers
entities.description: Individuals responsible for maintaining machinery in traditional manufacturing.

entities.name: production managers
entities.description: Individuals responsible for coordinating plant activities and aligning workforce skills with operational needs.

entities.name: automated packing technologies
entities.description: Technologies used to automate the packaging process.

entities.name: artificial intelligence (AI)
entities.description: A technology that can support inexperienced operators and assist managers in decision-making.

entities.name: AI4Work initiative
entities.description: An initiative aimed at addressing packaging challenges by focusing on troubleshooting, guiding operators, and optimizing plant activity planning.

entities.name: traditional manufacturing
entities.description: The process of manufacturing using non-automated equipment.

hyperedges.text: AI4Work aims to address packaging challenges by focusing on troubleshooting unexpected failures, guiding operators in routine tasks, and optimizing plant activity planning to improve productivity.

entities.name: AI4Work initiative
entities.description: An initiative aimed at addressing packaging challenges.

entities.name: packaging challenges
entities.description: Challenges faced in the packaging industry.

entities.name: unexpected failures
entities.description: Unexpected issues that may arise during packaging operations.

entities.name: routine tasks
entities.description: Routine activities performed by operators during packaging operations.

entities.name: plant activity planning
entities.description: The process of planning plant activities to improve productivity.

entities.name: productivity
entities.description: A measure of the efficiency and effectiveness of packaging operations.

hyperedges.text: AI4Work envisions innovative methods to effectively balance human resources with AI and robotic systems.

entities.name: AI4Work initiative
entities.description: An initiative aimed at addressing packaging challenges.

entities.name: human resources
entities.description: The workforce available for packaging operations.

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial intelligence used in packaging operations.

entities.name: robotic systems
entities.description: Robots used in packaging operations.

hyperedges.text: By integrating AI with tools like digital twins, companies can enhance collaboration between humans and machines, streamline human-machine interactions, and develop optimal strategies for scheduling tasks.

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial intelligence used in packaging operations.

entities.name: digital twins
entities.description: A digital representation of a physical entity or system used for simulation and analysis.

entities.name: companies
entities.description: Businesses involved in packaging operations.

entities.name: human-machine interactions
entities.description: Communication between humans and machines during packaging operations.

entities.name: scheduling tasks
entities.description: The process of assigning tasks to individuals or systems in packaging operations.

hyperedges.text: In the context of the Digital Assistant, a tool is proposed to leverage accumulated knowledge from past operator experiences to offer real-time guidance during troubleshooting activities.

entities.name: Digital Assistant
entities.description: A tool that offers real-time guidance during troubleshooting activities.

entities.name: past operator experiences
entities.description: The collective knowledge gained from previous operators' experiences.

entities.name: troubleshooting activities
entities.description: Activities aimed at resolving issues in packaging operations.

hyperedges.text: A troubleshooting tool analyzes faults using machine status and historical data.

entities.name: Troubleshooting Tool
entities.description: Analyzes faults.

entities.name: Faults
entities.description: Problems to be analyzed.

entities.name: Machine Status
entities.description: Current state of the machine.

entities.name: Historical Data
entities.description: Previous data about the machine.

hyperedges.text: The tool identifies new or unknown faults not yet present in the database.

entities.name: Troubleshooting Tool
entities.description: Identifies new or unknown faults.

entities.name: Faults
entities.description: Problems to be analyzed.

entities.name: Database
entities.description: Contains information about known faults.

hyperedges.text: A digital twin simulates machine behaviour.

entities.name: Digital Twin
entities.description: Represents the machine.

entities.name: Machine Behaviour
entities.description: Actions performed by the machine.

hyperedges.text: The virtual assistant facilitates training activities and supports operators in developing expertise.

entities.description: Provides training.

entities.name: Training Activities
entities.description: Activities related to learning.

entities.name: Operators
entities.description: People receiving the training.

entities.description: Accepts and responds to queries.

entities.name: Natural Language Queries
entities.description: User's questions in natural language.

hyperedges.text: Answers provided should consider the user's skill level.

entities.name: Answers
entities.description: Information given to users.

entities.name: User's Skill Level
entities.description: Ability of the user.

hyperedges.text: The assistant may also identify machine conditions requiring human intervention.

entities.name: Assistant
entities.description: Identifies machine conditions.

entities.name: Machine Conditions
entities.description: Current state of the machine.

entities.name: Human Intervention
entities.description: Involvement of humans in machine operations.

hyperedges.text: AI4Work generates dynamic production line plans.

entities.name: AI4Work
entities.description: Generates production plans.

entities.name: Production Line Plans
entities.description: Planned workflow.

entities.name: Human Resources
entities.description: Workforce available.

hyperedges.text: Plans must dynamically adapt to workload balancing requests.

entities.description: Adapts to workload balancing.

entities.name: Workload Balancing Requests
entities.description: Adjustments in the workflow.

hyperedges.text: Troubleshooting system integration

entities.description: Collects and processes real-time machine data to identify and analyze faults

entities.name: Human-Centred Digital Twins
entities.description: Simulates machine behaviour and past fault conditions, allowing operators to visualize and test solutions virtually

entities.name: Context Awareness
entities.description: Adapts troubleshooting recommendations based on the machine's current operating context and historical data

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing
entities.description: Enables flexible collaboration between humans and machines

entities.name: Data Collection and Handling for AI/Robotics Services
entities.description: Centralizes training data from operator manuals and real-time machine usage to create adaptive training modules

entities.name: Pilot-Specific Digital Twin
entities.description: Provides virtual environments where operators can practice procedures and interact with simulated machines

entities.name: Context Awareness
entities.description: Personalized training content to match the operator's skill level and the machine's current state

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing
entities.description: Allows the system to distribute training tasks dynamically, balancing human learning efforts with automated guidance

entities.name: Natural Language Processing
entities.description: Facilitates intuitive, conversational interactions between operators and the virtual training assistant

entities.name: Machine HMI
entities.description: Hardware/software component that enables humans to interact with the primary functions of the packaging machine

hyperedges.text: AI4Work Architecture adapted for the EP of the Manufacturing Pilot – Use Case 2

entities.name: AI4Work
entities.description: An integrated approach to ensure effective operation of complex machinery with minimal errors during training.

entities.name: Operators
entities.description: Individuals who operate complex machinery in the manufacturing pilot.

entities.name: Complex Machinery
entities.description: The equipment that operators work with in the manufacturing pilot.

entities.name: Activity Scheduling system
entities.description: A system employed to optimize resource utilization and maintain high productivity.

entities.name: Data Collection and Handling for AI/Robotics Services
entities.description: Gathers data on resource availability, production demands, and operational constraints.

entities.name: Human-Centred Digital Twins
entities.description: Simulates production scenarios including human operators to test and refine schedules before implementation.

entities.name: Human-Aware Task Planning
entities.description: Plans the workflow of operators and machines, considering human expertise and availability.

entities.name: Context Awareness
entities.description: Aware of a context change and sends this context change in real-time to the Sliding Work Sharing building block.

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing
entities.description: Ensures flexible task allocation, enabling efficient collaboration between human operators and automated systems.

entities.description: An integration of advanced technologies across all three use cases to deliver comprehensive, scalable solutions.

entities.description: The packaging operations in e-commerce.

entities.name: Advanced Technologies
entities.description: The technologies leveraged to enhance operational efficiency, support workforce adaptability, and enable seamless collaboration between humans and intelligent systems.

hyperedges.text: 4.4 Initial Plan – Early Prototypes

entities.name: Initial Plan
entities.description: The initial phase of the project focusing on early prototypes.

entities.name: 4.4.1 UC-MAN-1: Troubleshooting
entities.description: Define data model for 100% of available analytics.

hyperedges.text: Populate the experience storage with 500 entries [March ‘25]

entities.name: experience storage
entities.description: A system for storing experience data

entities.name: 500 entries
entities.description: The number of entries to be stored

entities.name: March ‘25
entities.description: The date when the entries will be populated

hyperedges.text: Collected entries may or may not include faulty conditions that require troubleshooting.

entities.name: collected entries
entities.description: The data collected from the field

entities.name: faulty conditions
entities.description: Issues that require troubleshooting

hyperedges.text: Assistance success rate of 80% in a virtual environment [June ‘25]

entities.name: assistance
entities.description: The service provided by the AI

entities.name: 80% success rate
entities.description: The expected success rate of the assistance

entities.name: virtual environment
entities.description: A simulated environment for testing

entities.name: June ‘25
entities.description: The date when the success rate will be evaluated

hyperedges.text: 4.4.2 UC-MAN-2: Training

entities.name: UC-MAN-2
entities.description: A specific training phase for the AI

entities.name: training
entities.description: The process of training the AI

hyperedges.text: Supervised service training for 50 situations [December ‘24]

entities.name: supervised service training
entities.description: The type of training for the AI

entities.name: 50 situations
entities.description: The number of situations to be trained on

entities.name: December ‘24
entities.description: The date when the training will start

hyperedges.text: In an initial phase, the specific AI will be trained using the troubleshooting manuals of the machines concerned.

entities.name: specific AI
entities.description: The particular AI being referred to

entities.name: troubleshooting manuals
entities.description: Documents detailing troubleshooting procedures

entities.name: machines concerned
entities.description: The machines for which the AI is being trained

hyperedges.text: This specific training process will enable the system to gain an in-depth understanding of at least 50 technical issues and applicable solutions to restore the plant operational efficiency.

entities.name: specific training process
entities.description: The particular training method being used

entities.name: 50 technical issues
entities.description: The number of technical problems the AI will understand

entities.name: applicable solutions
entities.description: The solutions to restore plant operational efficiency

entities.name: plant operational efficiency
entities.description: The efficiency of the plant's operations

hyperedges.text: In the event of an alarm, the machine stops, and the specific AI activates its training support function.

entities.name: alarm
entities.description: An indication of a problem or issue

entities.name: machine stops
entities.description: The machine ceasing to function

entities.name: specific AI
entities.description: The particular AI being referred to

entities.name: training support function
entities.description: A feature that assists in training the AI

hyperedges.text: Through the machine interface, the system provides the operator with detailed advice on how to solve the problem.

entities.name: machine interface
entities.description: The means of communication between the machine and the AI

entities.name: detailed advice
entities.description: Comprehensive guidance on solving a problem

entities.name: operator
entities.description: The individual operating the machine

entities.name: problem
entities.description: The problem that needs to be solved

hyperedges.text: During the system validation phase, an experienced machine operator evaluates the proposed solution.

entities.name: system validation phase
entities.description: A stage to verify the system's performance

entities.name: experienced machine operator
entities.description: An individual with expertise in operating machines

entities.name: proposed solution
entities.description: The solution suggested by the AI

hyperedges.text: A positive evaluation rate of 80% is expected.

entities.name: positive evaluation rate
entities.description: The level of approval for the solution
The expected percentage of positive evaluations

hyperedges.text: 4.4.3 UC-MAN-3: Activity Scheduling

entities.name: UC-MAN-3
entities.description: A specific phase for activity scheduling

entities.name: activity scheduling
entities.description: The process of organizing activities

hyperedges.text: O3.1 Optimise a 1-obj. problem involving 1 line, N packaging operators, 1 replenishment operator [December ‘24].

entities.name: Optimisation Problem
entities.description: Involves a single objective and a line with one E-CO Flex machine, N packaging operators (N >= 2), and one replenishment operator.

entities.name: Early Prototype
entities.description: Schedules the replenishment of a packaging line to minimize the number of replenishment actions.

hyperedges.text: O3.2 Implement 3D DES interfacing with O3.1 assessing plan execution time [June ‘25].

entities.name: Integration
entities.description: Between the Early Prototype and a 3D DES, testing the plan execution time.

entities.name: Early Prototype
entities.description: Simulates a single line with N packaging bays and one E-CO Flex machine, tests replenishment policy, estimates execution time, and provides operators' saturation and machines' states.

hyperedges.text: 4.5 Prototype Iteration Cycle

entities.name: Iterative Methodology
entities.description: Involves a collaborative interaction between technology providers and the end-user (IMA), testing, feedback collection, and refinement.

entities.name: AI4Work Prototypes
entities.description: Developed following this iterative methodology, progressively aligning with operational needs.

hyperedges.text: The iterative process involves digital twins, context-aware systems, R&D staff, and business unit staff to simulate and anticipate changes before implementation.

entities.name: iterative process
entities.description: A cycle of continuous improvement or repetition.

entities.name: digital twins
entities.description: Virtual replicas that represent physical assets or processes.

entities.name: context-aware systems
entities.description: Systems capable of responding to and adapting based on the current situation.

entities.name: R&D staff
entities.description: Research and development personnel involved in the process.

entities.name: business unit staff
entities.description: Business unit personnel involved in the process.

hyperedges.text: The prototype iteration cycle consists of early prototype, testing, feedback collection, refinement, final prototype, testing, feedback collection, and refinement stages.

entities.name: prototype iteration cycle
entities.description: A series of stages in the development of a prototype.

entities.name: early prototype
entities.description: The initial stage of the prototype development process.

entities.name: testing
entities.description: Evaluating the performance of a prototype.

entities.name: feedback collection
entities.description: Gathering user feedback on a prototype.

entities.name: refinement
entities.description: Improving the prototype based on feedback and testing results.

entities.name: final prototype
entities.description: The final stage of the prototype development process.

hyperedges.text: The prototype is tested in virtual or testbed environments during early and final prototype stages, and industrially relevant environments during final prototype testing.

entities.name: prototype
entities.description: A preliminary version of a product or system.

entities.name: virtual environment
entities.description: A simulated or digital environment.

entities.name: testbed
entities.description: A controlled environment for testing equipment or systems.

entities.name: industrially relevant environment
entities.description: An environment that represents real-world industrial conditions.

hyperedges.text: IMA technicians perform predefined tasks, monitor and collect feedback, and use prototypes in daily tasks and complex scenarios during the prototype iteration cycle.

entities.name: IMA technicians
entities.description: Technicians working for IMA (Industrial Maintenance Automation).

entities.name: predefined tasks
entities.description: Tasks that have been specifically defined or planned.

entities.name: feedback
entities.description: Opinions, comments, or suggestions provided by users about a product or service.
